channel.title: Can Kicksecure hardening be used on Ubuntu distros?
channel.description:
I made a post not too long ago asking about what host OS would be best for me. People floated the option of using Debian with Kicksecure hardening. However, from what I've seen, Debian seems like it can be a little more work to set up and maintain. For reasons I won't get into, I really have to avoid anything too complicated. I just want to turn on my computer and have it work.
I'm used to using Ubuntu based distributions such as Linux Mint and it's worked fine for the most part. I'm wondering if I could use Kicksecure on Ubuntu-based distros? If not, is it likely that it'll be compatible in the future? What about other Debian-based distributions such as Linux Mint Debian Edition?

item.title: Can Kicksecure hardening be used on Ubuntu distros?
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
glarsh:

So just to clarify, are you saying Kicksecure is just not tested on Ubuntu?

Corect.

glarsh:

Or that it actually won’t work on Ubuntu?

I wouldn’t know.

Read full topic
item.source: Can Kicksecure hardening be used on Ubuntu distros?

item.title: Can Kicksecure hardening be used on Ubuntu distros?
item.dc:creator: glarsh
item.description:
Thanks for your answer. So just to clarify, are you saying Kicksecure is just not tested on Ubuntu? Or that it actually won’t work on Ubuntu?

EDIT: And if Ubuntu + Kicksecure is untested, would there be any obvious issues that come to mind when thinking of using Kicksecure on Ubuntu? I’m just thinking of trying it myself but maybe there’s an obvious issue I’m missing.

Read full topic
item.source: Can Kicksecure hardening be used on Ubuntu distros?

item.title: Can Kicksecure hardening be used on Ubuntu distros?
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
glarsh:

I’m wondering if I could use Kicksecure on Ubuntu-based distros?

glarsh:

What about other Debian-based distributions such as Linux Mint Debian Edition?

Whonix – 28 Apr 21

Unsupported

This feature is either undocumented, untested, or unsupported. Options: Become a Contributor / Apply Free Support Principle / Purchase Professional Support.

glarsh:

If not, is it likely that it’ll be compatible in the future?

Whonix project has not received contributed ports to other base distributions in a decade.

(terminology: Debian is a base distribution.)

Related:

Whonix – 17 Apr 21

Dev/Operating System

Comparison and Consideration of various Operating Systems as base for the Whonix ™ Anonymous Operating System. Design Documentation.

One day there will be a Kicksecure host ISO. No ETA.

Also this page mentions Ubuntu:

Whonix – 29 Mar 21

Host Operating System Selection

Host Operating System Selection, OS Threats to Privacy and Security

Read full topic
item.source: Can Kicksecure hardening be used on Ubuntu distros?
